DataElement.preferredDefinition: An explanation of why sufficient normal tissue from a non-diseased patient was not collected.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To go beyond some value, or to be greater than or superior to something.: The time interval from blood supply separation or reduction to further processing, preservation, or blood supply reconnection for a tissue, organ, or body part.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tumor Tissue Type Negation Approved Protocol

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tumor Tissue Type Negation Approved Protocol
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Protocol is approved by the review board.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Protocol is approved by the review board.

An indication that there was not enough sample available.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.: Postpone indefinitely or annul something that was scheduled.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Postpone indefinitely or annul something that was scheduled.
